alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Lee; Owsley; Perry; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 10:39AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Owsley, west central Perry, Jackson, northeastern Rockcastle, southwestern Breathitt, southwestern Lee and northern Clay Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1039 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Rockford to Lakes to White Ash. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Beattyville, New Zion, Turkey Foot, Pebworth, Lower Buffalo, Ida May, Lakes, Corgleton, Wind Cave and Enoch around 1045 AM EDT. McKee, Booneville, Levi, Stay, Grass, Vincent, Bradshaw and Lone around 1050 AM EDT. Turin, Chestnut Gap, Privett, Scoville, Gray Hawk, Endee, Lerose, Travellers Rest and Atkinstown around 1055 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Mummie, Elian, Eversole, Major, Green Hall, Kerby Knob, Sturgeon, Mildred, Olin, Hisel, Southfork, Maulden, Nathanton, Threelinks, Herd, Conkling, Zekes Point, Climax, Cowcreek, Tyner, Gobbard, Ricetown, Eglon, Goochland, Taff, Island City, Collingsworth, Egypt, Sandgap, Arnett, Sebastian, Sourwood, Sextons Creek, Trixie, Lucky Fork, Johnetta, Shepherdtown, High Knob, Morris Fork, Waneta, Chestnutburg, Loam, Sacker Gap, Newfound, Malcomb, Robinet, Cooksburg, Valjean, Teges and Thomas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Lee; Owsley; Perry; Rockcastle
